properties.areaDesc: Boone, WV; Putnam, WV; Lincoln, WV
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 13 at 10:07AM EST until February 13 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Charleston WV
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Charleston has issued a

* Flood Warning for...
Northwestern Boone County in central West Virginia...
Central Lincoln County in central West Virginia...
Southern Putnam County in western West Virginia...

* Until 400 PM EST.

* At 1007 AM EST, Rain from yesterday, overnight and this morning
has caused the Middle Fork and the Mud Rivers to rise. Flooding is
ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warning area.

At 9:30 AM EST, the stage near Griffithsville on the Middle Fork of
the Mud river is 11.76 feet.  The estimated flood stage is 12 feet.
The river is expected to go over the estimated flood stage later
this morning and crest slightly over 12 feet around noon, then start
a slow fall later this afternoon.  At stages near 12 feet, fields
and low areas along the Middle Fork Mud River both upstream and
downstream are flooded.  Some low areas on County Route 22 (Scary
Creek Road) start to flood.

Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Hamlin, Spurlockville, Griffithsville, Palermo, Yawkey, Sweetland,
Alkol, Mud, Myra and Woodville.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are
potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded
roads. Find an alternate route.

Please report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by
calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely. You may
also report severe weather by posting your report to the Charleston
West Virginia National Weather Service Facebook Page, or by using
the Twitter Hashtag, NWSRLX.
